articleContent.title: Chord: Dominant 7#5 in C# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Dominant 7#5 in C# (Shape: D)

## Description
The Dominant 7#5 chord, also known as the augmented 7th chord, is a four-note chord consisting of the root note, major third, augmented fifth, and minor seventh. In the key of C#, this chord is represented with the shape of a D chord, producing a bold and tense sound due to the augmented fifth interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: C#
- Major Third: E#
- Augmented Fifth: Gx
- Minor Seventh: B

## Genre and Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 chord is commonly found in jazz, fusion, and experimental music. It adds dissonance and tension to a musical piece, creating a sense of unpredictability and leading the listener to expect resolution. This chord is often used to introduce spicy and vibrant tones into compositions, expanding the harmonic palette.

## Songs
Here are three songs that make use of the Dominant 7#5 chord:
1. "Spain" by Chick Corea - This jazz fusion classic features the Dominant 7#5 chord in various progressions, adding a sophisticated and dynamic element to the piece.
2. "Giant Steps" by John Coltrane - A jazz standard known for its complex chord progressions, "Giant Steps" includes the Dominant 7#5 chord to create harmonic tension and propel the improvisational sections.
3. "Bohemian Rhapsody" by Queen - In this iconic rock ballad, Queen incorporates the Dominant 7#5 chord during the operatic section, contributing to the dramatic and operatic atmosphere of the song.
